commentBody: This man is the most outrageously overpaid man in the U.S. He has no investment in his "company"; he has no downside risk associated with his performance; he has no downside financial risk in the performance of his company; his performance is not related to his compensation; his principal job attribute, his TV deals, could and should be done by an executive vice president. An empty suit whose job could be performed at least equally well by myriad executives for a small fraction of this amount. How the league gets away with treating this as a Section 212 ordinary and necessary business expense is beyond me.
